New Records: Virat Kohli is one short of equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record of most ODI hundreds
Key Match Events: Lungi Ngidi b Kuldeep Yadav 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0
Pre-Game Insights: India prefer having a target in front of them so that they can pace their innings accordingly.
South Africa love to bat first and their top order invariably sets the platform for the middle to go big.
This match will also present the sternest test so far for India's five-bowler strategy.
Bavuma has hinted that South Africa could play both Keshav Maharaj and Tabraiz Shamsi.
India must be one of Quinton de Kock's favourite opponents.
With Bavuma struggling for form, de Kock's role becomes even more important in setting the platform for the middle order to tee off.
Post-Match Reflections: India head coach Rahul Dravid said, 'It is a contest between two teams that are playing very good cricket.'

South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said, 'You got two teams who are in form, coming up against each other and I think it's just a matter of who breaks first and who's able to I guess, exploit that moment or that weakness.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at Eden Gardens hasn't really favoured a particular type of bowling.
Dew could play a role in the second innings.
Virat Kohli is yet to get out to spin in this World Cup.
Among those who have bowled at least 15 overs in this World Cup, only two have economy rates under four: Jasprit Bumrah (3.72) and Ravindra Jadeja (3.78).
Marco Jansen has picked up 12 wickets in the powerplay in this World Cup - the most by any bowler in that phase.
South Africa's 82 sixes in the tournament are the most by any team in a single edition of the World Cup.
Others: India are likely to field an unchanged XI, with KL Rahul now officially the vice-captain of the team.
Bavuma has hinted that South Africa could play both Keshav Maharaj and Tabraiz Shamsi.
Lungi Ngidi has dismissed Shreyas Iyer four times in 30 balls in ODIs.
Maharaj is two short of 50 ODI wickets.
